alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Durham; Granville; Orange; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 9:05PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Orange, southern Granville, northwestern Wake, Durham and northeastern Chatham Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 905 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Creedmoor to 6 miles south of Butner to near Chapel Hill. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Chapel Hill, Creedmoor, Carrboro, Butner, RDU International, Morrisville and Stem. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
